description: Test fixture: PR that violates non-goals (scope creep)

pr.title: Implement advanced ML-based code quality prediction engine
pr.body: Adds sophisticated machine learning model to predict code quality issues using static analysis, AST parsing, and semantic understanding. This will revolutionize how we detect potential problems in PRs.

goals: Enforce deterministic, machine-checkable PR hygiene via a single required check run
Deliver fast tri-state verdicts (success|failure|neutral) with fail-safe neutral on errors
non_goals: Re-implementing mature OSS scanners, linters, or policy managers
Long-running or heavy in-process analysis that degrades PR latency
Subjective style enforcement beyond explicit repo rules/policies

violations.finding: Introduces complex ML-based analysis which directly contradicts non-goal about avoiding heavy in-process analysis
violated_non_goals: Long-running or heavy in-process analysis that degrades PR latency
violations.suggested_action: Consider integrating existing mature analysis tools instead of implementing custom ML solution

violations.finding: Adding ML capabilities significantly expands scope beyond current PR hygiene focus
violations.suggested_action: Update repository goals to explicitly include ML-based analysis or remove ML components

expected_result.summary: PR introduces complex ML analysis that violates non-goals about heavy processing and scope boundaries
